    • Method Detail

      • setClassInJar

        public void setClassInJar(java.lang.Object theObj)
        In order to load resources from inside a jar file, a class will be needed from inside the jar.
        Parameters:
        theObj - - A dummy object that is from inside the desired jar.

      • addToAutoDrawSet

        public void addToAutoDrawSet(Engine.Primitive addPrimitive)
        Adds the given primitive to the draw set to be automatically drawn each frame. The primitive will be drawn in front of all other primitives if it is marked to be always on top. If not marked to be always on top, it will be on top of all primitives except those marked as always on top.
        Parameters:
        addPrimitive - - A primitive to draw automatically each frame.

      • removeFromAutoDrawSet

        public void removeFromAutoDrawSet(Engine.Primitive addPrimitive)
        Removes the given primitive from the draw set. Primitives in the draw set are automatically drawn each frame.
        Parameters:
        addPrimitive - - Primitive to remove from the draw set.

      • moveToBackOfDrawSet

        public void moveToBackOfDrawSet(Engine.Primitive thePrimitive)
        Moves the primitive to be drawn behind all other primitives in the draw set.
        Parameters:
        thePrimitive - - The primitive to move to the back.

      • moveToFrontOfDrawSet

        public void moveToFrontOfDrawSet(Engine.Primitive thePrimitive)
        Move the primitive to be drawn in front of all other primitives. The primitive will be drawn in front of all other primitives if it is marked to be always on top. If not marked to be always on top, it will be on top of all primitives except those marked as always on top.
        Parameters:
        thePrimitive - the primitive to be moved to the front of drawset.

      • drawDrawSet

        public void drawDrawSet()
        Draws all primitives in the draw set.

      • setGraphics

        public void setGraphics(java.awt.Graphics newGraphics)
        Set the graphics which resources should be drawn with.
        Parameters:
        newGraphics - - The graphics to draw with.

      • setWorld

        public void setWorld(World aWorld)
        Set the world to use to convert from world space to pixel space.
        Parameters:
        aWorld - - The world to use for conversions internally.

      • readFileBytes

        public byte[] readFileBytes(java.lang.String filename)
        Read the given file name and return the contents as bytes.
        Parameters:
        filename - - The file to read.
        Returns:
        - The contents of the given file. Will be null if there was a problem.

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Cleans any resources that should not exists if the program were to close. Stops and clears all loaded sounds.

      • preloadSound

        public void preloadSound(java.lang.String fileName,
                         int numberToPreload)
        Loads and stores a sound to be played later.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The file name of the sound to be loaded.
        numberToPreload - - How many duplicates of the sound should be loaded. This is basically an estimate of the maximum number of this sound that might play at the same time. If the estimate was not high enough, duplicates will be created as needed.

      • preloadSound

        public void preloadSound(java.lang.String fileName)
        Loads and stores a sound to be played later. Default to only loading one instance of the sound.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The file to load the sound from.

      • isSoundPlaying

        public boolean isSoundPlaying(java.lang.String fileName)
        Will return true if the given sound is currently playing
        Parameters:
        fileName: - filename of the audio file to be tested.
        Returns:
        true: sounds is playing, false otherwise

      • playSound

        public boolean playSound(java.lang.String fileName)
        Plays the sound at the given file name. If the sound has loaded previously, it will not be loaded from disk again.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The file name of the sound to play.
        Returns:
        - Return true if the sound was told to start playing. Will return false if there was a problem or the sound could not be played (possibly for internal reasons).

      • playSoundLooping

        public boolean playSoundLooping(java.lang.String fileName)
        Plays the sound at the given file name. If the sound has loaded previously, it will not be loaded from disk again. The sound will restart after it reaches the end of the sound clip.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The file name of the sound to play.
        Returns:
        - Return true if the sound was told to start playing. Will return false if there was a problem or the sound could not be played (possibly for internal reasons).

      • playSound

        public boolean playSound(java.lang.String fileName,
                         boolean playInLoop)
        Plays the sound at the given file name. If the sound has loaded previously, it will not be loaded from disk again. The sound may be set to repeat itself.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The file name of the sound to play.
        playInLoop - - Set to true if the sound should repeat after it plays.
        Returns:
        - Return true if the sound was told to start playing. Will return false if there was a problem or the sound could not be played (possibly for internal reasons).

      • stopSound

        public boolean stopSound(java.lang.String fileName)
        Stops all instances of the given sound.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The file name of the sound to stop.
        Returns:
        - True if the sound was at least loaded at some point, false otherwise.

      • setPauseSound

        public void setPauseSound(boolean value)
        Pauses or resumes all instances of all sounds.
        Parameters:
        value - - True if sounds should pause, false to resume.

      • pauseSound

        public void pauseSound()
        Pause all sounds.

      • resumeSound

        public void resumeSound()
        Resume all sounds.

      • setMuteSound

        public void setMuteSound(boolean value)
        Mutes or unmutes all instances of all sounds. Any sounds loaded after calling this will be set to the same mute value.
        Parameters:
        value - - True if sounds should mute, false otherwise.

      • muteSound

        public void muteSound()
        Mute all sounds.

      • unmuteSound

        public void unmuteSound()
        Unmute all sounds.

      • toggleMuteSound

        public void toggleMuteSound()
        Toggle if all sounds are muted.

      • getMuteSound

        public boolean getMuteSound()
        Check if sounds are set to be muted.
        Returns:
        - True if sounds are set as mute, false otherwise.

      • setSoundVolume

        public boolean setSoundVolume(java.lang.String fileName,
                              float volume)
        Set the volume for all instances of the given sound.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - File name of the sound to change volume for.
        volume - - The volume to change to, should be between 0.0f amd 1.0f inclusively.
        Returns:
        - True if the sound has been loaded before, false otherwise.

      • setSoundVolume

        public void setSoundVolume(float volume)
        Set the volume for all instances of all sounds. Sounds played after this has been set will also have the same volume.
        Parameters:
        volume - - The volume to set all sounds to. Should be between 0.0f amd 1.0f inclusively.

      • getSoundVolume

        public float getSoundVolume()
        Get the volume that sounds are set to.
        Returns:
        - The volume of all sounds.

      • sleep

        public void sleep(int miliseconds)
        Sleep for a set number of miliseconds.
        Parameters:
        miliseconds - - Number of miliseconds to sleep.

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage texture,
                      float x1,
                      float y1,
                      float x2,
                      float y2,
                      float degrees)
        Draw an image with the given lower left and upper right coordinates and with the given rotation. Coordinates should be in world space.
        Parameters:
        texture - - The image to draw.
        x1 - - Lower left x coordinate.
        y1 - - Lower left y coordinate.
        x2 - - Upper right x coordinate.
        y2 - - Upper right y coordinate.
        degrees - - Number of degrees to rotate.

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage texture,
                      float x1,
                      float y1,
                      float x2,
                      float y2,
                      int srcX1,
                      int srcY1,
                      int srcX2,
                      int srcY2,
                      float degrees)
        Draw an image with the given lower left and upper right coordinates and with the given rotation. Coordinates should be in world space. Also provided are the coordinates of the source image to draw from.
        Parameters:
        texture - - The image to draw.
        x1 - - Lower left x coordinate.
        y1 - - Lower left y coordinate.
        x2 - - Upper right x coordinate.
        y2 - - Upper right y coordinate.
        srcX1 - - Source image x start position.
        srcY1 - - Source image y start position.
        srcX2 - - Source image x end position.
        srcY2 - - Source image y end position.
        degrees - - Number of degrees to rotate.

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage texture,
                      float x1,
                      float y1,
                      float x2,
                      float y2,
                      float srcX1,
                      float srcY1,
                      float srcX2,
                      float srcY2,
                      float degrees)
        Draw an image with the given lower left and upper right coordinates and with the given rotation. Coordinates should be in world space. Also provided are the coordinates (as a percentage of the dimensions) of the source image to draw from.
        Parameters:
        texture - - The image to draw.
        x1 - - Lower left x coordinate.
        y1 - - Lower left y coordinate.
        x2 - - Upper right x coordinate.
        y2 - - Upper right y coordinate.
        srcX1 - - Source image x start percent.
        srcY1 - - Source image y start percent.
        srcX2 - - Source image x end percent.
        srcY2 - - Source image y end percent.
        degrees - - Number of degrees to rotate.

                            int b)
        Set the RGB color to draw with.
        Parameters:

        g - - The green value.
        b - - The blue value.
